Subject: Re: [junit] Applicability - Where not to Use JUnit

Sateesh,

Based on your options, i would recommend going with JUnit, since:
1. You get more bang for your buck testing closer to code
2. regression !!!! try doing all these tests manually , exactly like you did them before
3. Extensibility, JUnit has been adopted by mostly all open source tools
4. maybe use DBUnit, (like Kamlesh suggested)

I totally agree with Joel Neely, since he already said all the above, already. but since you asked my personal opinion....

Hope this helps.

But, since your application is database bound, HOW are you going to use JUnit to verify what is in the database? unless you use dbunit, or API's like XQuery and XPath

I recomended Xpath and Xquery, since this will give your testers a huge leap in tecnology, which they can use in the future. but it is your decision.

Thanks,
-Kamal.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: sateeshkumar.soundarapandian@... 
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, March 26, 2008 9:01 AM
  Subject: RE: [junit] Applicability - Where not to Use JUnit


  Hi Kamal,

  We are now not in the timeline of using other tools like
  XPath, XQuery. Please let me tell which is better 

  1. Go with JUnit even it is cumbersome or

  2. Go for Manual testing

  with regards,

  Sateesh

  Sateesh,

  try a combination of XQuery and Xpath, using JUnit as an assert
  structure, and you have yourself a frame work to test your application.

  -Kamal.
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Sateesh 
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com> 
  Sent: Wednesday, March 26, 2008 3:36 AM
  Subject: [junit] Applicability - Where not to Use JUnit

  Hi, 
  In our application, we planned to use JUnit. but our application is 
  like fetching, inserting, updating data in the databases. there is no 
  domain bussiness logics involved. that is there will be no 
  calculations etc., We feel that for our application testing could be 
  done manually. Even if we try with JUnit, the time taken for test case 
  preparation is almost equal to the time taken to implement the 
  functionality. Pls instruct me.

  with regards,
  Sateesh
